title: ping probs

embed.description: Test your mobile network speed, wherever you may be. Download the free Ookla Speedtest app for iOS, Amazon, Android or Windows Phone.

body:
after about 12:00 my ping went down the drain, i was having about 250ish ping for three games, after each game i would go upstairs and reset my router by unplugging it, resting then hitting the reset button for a firm fresh start and it did not change all three times, each time i would also unplug my ethernet cable each time to try and refresh everything. i got on overwatch after and have smooth 52 ping all game. i did a internet test as well and the test gave me 19 ping as a result.
http://www.speedtest.net/result/5506430995.png

replies.body:
Different servers for different services (or games) reside in different physical locations. This is why it's possible to have a good latency (ping) to one server, but not another. There are a number of things that could be causing this to happen, though the guide that *Rineyy* linked is the best place to start troubleshooting this. 

Let me know if you still have issues after working through the connection guide.
it ended up fixing itself a day later and went back down to its standard 50 ping, thank you guys for the help!
